   20: -module(disksup_SUITE).
   21: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server specific exports
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   25: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   26: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: %% Test cases
   29: -export([api/1, config/1, alarm/1]).
   30: -export([port/1]).
   31: -export([terminate/1, unavailable/1, restart/1]).
   32: -export([otp_5910/1]).
   33: -export([posix_only/1, parse_df_output_posix/1, parse_df_output_susv3/1]).
   34: 
   35: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   36:     ok = application:start(os_mon),
   37:     Config.
   38: 
   39: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   40:     ok = application:stop(os_mon),
   41:     Config.
   42: 
   43: init_per_testcase(unavailable, Config) ->
   44:     terminate(Config),
   45:     init_per_testcase(dummy, Config);
   46: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC =:= unavailable;
   50:                                   TC =:= posix_only ->
   51:     restart(Config),
   52:     end_per_testcase(dummy, Config);
   53: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: suite() ->
   57:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   58:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   59: 
   60: all() -> 
   61:     Bugs = [otp_5910],
   62:     Always = [api, config, alarm, port, posix_only, unavailable,
   63:               parse_df_output_posix, parse_df_output_susv3] ++ Bugs,
   64:     case os:type() of
   65: 	{unix, _OSname} -> Always;
   66: 	{win32, _OSname} -> Always;
   67: 	_OS -> [unavailable]
   68:     end.
   69: 
   70: %% Test of API functions
   71: api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72: 
   73:     %% get_disk_data()
   74:     ok = check_get_disk_data(),
   75: 
   76:     %% get_disk_info()
   77:     ok = check_get_disk_info(),
   78: 
   79:     %% get_check_interval()
   80:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
   81: 
   82:     %% set_check_interval(Minutes)
   83:     ok = disksup:set_check_interval(20),
   84:     1200000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
   85:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch disksup:set_check_interval(0.5)),
   86:     1200000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
   87:     ok = disksup:set_check_interval(30),
   88: 
   89:     %% set_check_interval({TimeUnit, Time})
   90:     ok = disksup:set_check_interval({second, 1}),
   91:     1000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
   92:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch disksup:set_check_interval({second, 0.5})),
   93:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch disksup:set_check_interval({badarg, 1})),
   94:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch disksup:set_check_interval({nanosecond, 1})),
   95:     1000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
   96:     ok = disksup:set_check_interval(30),
   97: 
   98:     %% get_almost_full_threshold()
   99:     80 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  100: 
  101:     %% set_almost_full_threshold(Float)
  102:     ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(0.90),
  103:     90 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  104:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  105: 	(catch disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(-0.5)),
  106:     90 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  107:     ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(0.80),
  108: 
  109:     ok.
  110: 
  111: %% Test configuration
  112: config(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  113: 
  114:     %% Change configuration parameters and make sure change is reflected
  115:     %% when disksup is restarted
  116:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, 29),
  117:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_almost_full_threshold, 0.81),
  118: 
  119:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  120:     {ok, _Child1} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  121: 
  122:     1740000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  123:     81 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  124: 
  125:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, {second, 2}),
  126: 
  127:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  128:     {ok, _Child2} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  129: 
  130:     2000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  131: 
  132:     %% Also try this with bad parameter values, should be ignored
  133:     ok =
  134: 	application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, 0.5),
  135:     ok =
  136: 	application:set_env(os_mon, disk_almost_full_threshold, -0.81),
  137: 
  138:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  139:     {ok, _Child3} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  140: 
  141:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  142:     80 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  143: 
  144:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, {second, 0.5}),
  145: 
  146:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  147:     {ok, _Child4} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  148: 
  149:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  150: 
  151:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, {badarg, 1}),
  152: 
  153:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  154:     {ok, _Child5} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  155: 
  156:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  157: 
  158:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, {nanosecond, 1}),
  159: 
  160:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  161:     {ok, _Child6} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  162: 
  163:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  164: 
  165:     %% Reset configuration parameters
  166:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_space_check_interval, 30),
  167:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_almost_full_threshold, 0.80),
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  171: %% NOTE: The test case is a bit weak as it will fail if the disk usage
  172: %% changes too much during its course, or if there are timing problems
  173: %% with the alarm_handler receiving the alarms too late
  174: %%----------------------------------------------------------------------
  175: 
  176: %% Test that alarms are set and cleared
  177: alarm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178: 
  179:     %% Find out how many disks exceed the threshold
  180:     %% and make sure the corresponding number of alarms is set
  181:     Threshold1 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(), % 80
  182:     Data1 = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  183:     Over1 = over_threshold(Data1, Threshold1),
  184:     Alarms1 = get_alarms(),
  185:     if
  186: 	Over1==length(Alarms1) ->
  187: 	    true;
  188: 	true ->
  189: 	    dump_info(),
  190: 	    ct:fail({bad_alarms, Threshold1, Data1, Alarms1})
  191:     end,
  192: 
  193:     %% Try to find a disk with space usage below Threshold1,
  194:     %% lower the threshold accordingly and make sure new alarms are set
  195:     Fun1 = fun({_Id, _Kbyte, Capacity}) ->
  196: 		   if
  197: 		       Capacity>0, Capacity<Threshold1 -> true;
  198: 		       true -> false
  199: 		   end
  200: 	   end,
  201:     case until(Fun1, Data1) of
  202: 	      {_, _, Cap1} ->
  203: 		  Threshold2 = Cap1-1,
  204: 		  ok =
  205: 		      disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(Threshold2/100),
  206: 		  disksup ! timeout, % force a disk check
  207: 		  Data2 = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  208: 		  Over2 = over_threshold(Data2, Threshold2),
  209: 		  Alarms2 = get_alarms(),
  210: 		  if
  211: 		      Over2==length(Alarms2), Over2>Over1 ->
  212: 			  true;
  213: 		      true ->
  214: 			  dump_info(),
  215: 			  ct:fail({bad_alarms, Threshold2, Data2, Alarms2})
  216: 		  end;
  217: 	      false ->
  218: 		  ignore
  219: 	  end,
  220: 
  221:     %% Find out the highest space usage among all disks
  222:     %% and try to raise the threshold above this value,
  223:     %% make sure all alarms are cleared
  224:     Fun2 = fun({_Id, _Kbyte, Capacity}, MaxAcc) ->
  225: 		   if
  226: 		       Capacity>MaxAcc -> Capacity;
  227: 		       true -> MaxAcc
  228: 		   end
  229: 	   end,
  230:     case lists:foldl(Fun2, 0, Data1) of
  231: 	      Max when Max<100 ->
  232: 		  Threshold3 = Max+1,
  233: 		  ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(Threshold3/100),
  234: 		  disksup ! timeout, % force a disk check
  235: 		  Data3   = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  236: 		  Over3   = over_threshold(Data3, Threshold3),
  237: 		  Alarms3 = get_alarms(),
  238: 		  if
  239: 		      Over3==0, length(Alarms3)==0 ->
  240: 			  ok;
  241: 		      true ->
  242: 			  dump_info(),
  243: 			  ct:fail({bad_alarms, Threshold3, Data3, Alarms3})
  244: 		  end;
  245: 	      100 ->
  246: 		  ignore
  247: 	  end,
  248: 
  249:     %% Reset threshold
  250:     ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(Threshold1/100),
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: over_threshold(Data, Threshold) ->
  254:     Data2 = remove_duplicated_disks(lists:keysort(1, Data)),
  255:     lists:foldl(fun
  256: 	    ({_Id, _Kbyte, Cap}, N) when Cap>=Threshold -> N+1;
  257: 	    (_DiskData, N) -> N
  258: 	end, 0, Data2).
  259: 
  260: %% On some platforms (for example MontaVista) data for one disk can be
  261: %% "duplicated":
  262: %%  Linux ppb 2.4.20_mvl31-pcore680 #1 Sun Feb 1 23:12:56 PST 2004 ppc unknown
  263: %%
  264: %%  MontaVista(R) Linux(R) Professional Edition 3.1
  265: %%
  266: %%  [ppb:~]> /bin/df -lk
  267: %%  Filesystem           1k-blocks      Used Available Use% Mounted on
  268: %%  rootfs                 8066141   3023763   4961717  38% /
  269: %%  /dev/root              8066141   3023763   4961717  38% /
  270: %%  tmpfs                   192892         0    192892   0% /dev/shm
  271: %%
  272: %% disksup:
  273: %%  [{"/",8066141,38}, {"/",8066141,38}, {"/dev/shm",192892,0}]
  274: %%
  275: %% disksup will only set ONE alarm for "/".
  276: %% Therefore the list of disk data must be sorted and duplicated disk
  277: %% tuples removed before calculating how many alarms should be set, or
  278: %% the testcase will fail erroneously.
  279: remove_duplicated_disks([{Id, _, _}, {Id, Kbyte, Cap}|T]) ->
  280:     remove_duplicated_disks([{Id, Kbyte, Cap}|T]);
  281: remove_duplicated_disks([H|T]) ->
  282:     [H|remove_duplicated_disks(T)];
  283: remove_duplicated_disks([]) ->
  284:     [].
  285: 
  286: get_alarms() ->
  287:     lists:filter(fun
  288: 	    ({{disk_almost_full, _Disk},_}) -> true;
  289: 	    (_) -> false
  290: 	end, alarm_handler:get_alarms()).
  291: 
  292: until(Fun, [H|T]) ->
  293:     case Fun(H) of
  294: 	true -> H;
  295: 	false -> until(Fun, T)
  296:     end;
  297: until(_Fun, []) -> false.
  298: 
  299: %% Test that disksup handles a terminating port program
  300: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     Str = os:cmd("ps -ef | grep '[d]isksup'"),
  302:     case io_lib:fread("~s ~s", Str) of
  303: 	{ok, [_Uid,Pid], _Rest} ->
  304: 
  305: 	    %% Monitor disksup
  306: 	    MonRef = erlang:monitor(process, disksup),
  307: 	    [{_Disk1,Kbyte1,_Cap1}|_] = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  308: 	    true = Kbyte1>0,
  309: 
  310: 	    %% Kill the port program
  311: 	    case os:cmd("kill -9 " ++ Pid) of
  312: 		[] ->
  313: 
  314: 		    %% disksup should now terminate
  315: 		    receive
  316: 			{'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, {port_died, _Reason}} ->
  317: 			    ok;
  318: 			{'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, Reason} ->
  319: 			    ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason, Reason})
  320: 		    after
  321: 			3000 ->
  322: 			    ct:fail({still_alive, Str})
  323: 		    end,
  324: 
  325: 		    %% Give os_mon_sup time to restart disksup
  326: 		    ct:sleep({seconds,3}),
  327: 		    [{_Disk2,Kbyte2,_Cap2}|_] = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  328: 		    true = Kbyte2>0,
  329: 
  330: 		    ok;
  331: 
  332: 		Line ->
  333: 		    erlang:demonitor(MonRef),
  334: 		    {skip, {not_killed, Line}}
  335: 	    end;
  336: 	_ ->
  337: 	    {skip, {os_pid_not_found, Str}}
  338:     end.
  339: 
  340: terminate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_disksup, false),
  342:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  343:     ok.
  344: 
  345: %% Test correct behaviour when service is unavailable
  346: unavailable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  347: 
  348:     %% Make sure all API functions return their dummy values
  349:     [{"none",0,0}] = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  350:     1800000 = disksup:get_check_interval(),
  351:     ok = disksup:set_check_interval(5),
  352:     80 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  353:     ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(0.9),
  354:     ok.
  355: 
  356: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  357:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_disksup, true),
  358:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disksup_posix_only, false),
  359:     case supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup) of
  360:         {ok, _Pid} -> ok;
  361:         {error, running} -> ok
  362:     end.
  363: 
  364: %% Test that alarms are cleared if disksup crashes or
  365: %% if OS_Mon is stopped
  366: otp_5910(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  367: 
  368:     %% Make sure disksup sets at least one alarm
  369:     Data = lists:sort(disksup:get_disk_data()),
  370:     Threshold0 = disksup:get_almost_full_threshold(),
  371:     Threshold  = case over_threshold(Data, Threshold0) of
  372: 		     0 ->
  373: 			 [{_Id,_Kbyte,Cap}|_] = Data,
  374: 			 io:format("Data ~p Threshold ~p ~n",[Data, Cap-1]),
  375: 			 ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold((max(0, Cap-1))/100),
  376: 			 max(0, Cap-1);
  377: 		     _N -> Threshold0
  378: 		 end,
  379:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disk_almost_full_threshold, Threshold/100),
  380:     disksup ! timeout, % force a disk check
  381:     Data2 = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  382:     Over = over_threshold(Data2, Threshold),
  383:     Alarms = get_alarms(),
  384:     if
  385: 	Over==0 ->
  386: 	    ct:fail({threshold_too_low, Data2, Threshold});
  387: 	Over==length(Alarms) ->
  388: 	    ok;
  389: 	true ->
  390: 	    dump_info(),
  391: 	    ct:fail({bad_alarms, Threshold, Data2, Alarms})
  392:     end,
  393: 
  394:     %% Kill disksup
  395:     exit(whereis(disksup), faked_disksup_crash),
  396: 
  397:     %% Wait a little to make sure disksup has been restarted,
  398:     %% then make sure the alarms are set once, but not twice
  399:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  400:     Data3   = disksup:get_disk_data(),
  401:     Alarms2 = get_alarms(),
  402:     if
  403: 	length(Alarms2)==length(Alarms) -> ok;
  404: 	true ->
  405: 	    dump_info(),
  406: 	    ct:fail({bad_alarms,Threshold,Data3,Alarms,Alarms2})
  407:     end,
  408: 
  409:     %% Stop OS_Mon and make sure all disksup alarms are cleared
  410:     ok = application:stop(os_mon),
  411:     ct:sleep({seconds,1}),
  412:     Alarms3 = get_alarms(),
  413:     case get_alarms() of
  414: 	[] -> ok;
  415: 	_  -> ct:fail({alarms_not_cleared, Alarms3})
  416:     end,
  417: 
  418:     %% Reset threshold and restart OS_Mon
  419:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disksup_almost_full_threshold, 0.8),
  420:     ok = disksup:set_almost_full_threshold(0.8),
  421:     ok = application:start(os_mon),
  422:     ok.
  423: 
  424: %% Test disksup_posix_only option
  425: posix_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  426:     %% Set option and restart disksup
  427:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, disksup_posix_only, true),
  428:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  429:     {ok, _Child1} = supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, disksup),
  430: 
  431:     ok = check_get_disk_data().
  432: 
  433: dump_info() ->
  434:     io:format("Status: ~p~n", [sys:get_status(disksup)]).
  435: 
  436: check_get_disk_data() ->
  437:     [{Id,KByte,Capacity}|_] = get_disk_data(),
  438:     true = io_lib:printable_list(Id),
  439:     true = is_integer(KByte),
  440:     true = is_integer(Capacity),
  441:     true = Capacity>0,
  442:     true = KByte>0,
  443:     ok.
  444: 
  445: check_get_disk_info() ->
  446:     DiskInfo = disksup:get_disk_info(),
  447:     [{Id, TotalKiB, AvailableKiB, Capacity}|_] = DiskInfo,
  448:     true = io_lib:printable_list(Id),
  449:     true = is_integer(TotalKiB),
  450:     true = is_integer(AvailableKiB),
  451:     true = is_integer(Capacity),
  452:     true = TotalKiB > 0,
  453:     true = AvailableKiB > 0,
  454: 
  455:     [DiskInfoRoot|_] = disksup:get_disk_info("/"),
  456:     {"/", TotalKiBRoot, AvailableKiBRoot, CapacityRoot} = DiskInfoRoot,
  457:     true = is_integer(TotalKiBRoot),
  458:     true = is_integer(AvailableKiBRoot),
  459:     true = is_integer(CapacityRoot),
  460:     true = TotalKiBRoot > 0,
  461:     true = AvailableKiBRoot > 0,
  462:     ok.
  463: 
  464: % filter get_disk_data and remove entriew with zero capacity
  465: % "non-normal" filesystems report zero capacity
  466: % - Perhaps erroneous 'df -k -l'?
  467: % - Always list filesystems by type '-t ufs,zfs,..' instead?
  468: % It is unclear what the intention was from the beginning.
  469: get_disk_data() ->
  470:     get_disk_data(disksup:get_disk_data()).
  471: 
  472: get_disk_data([{"none",0,0}=E]) -> [E];
  473: get_disk_data([{_,_,0}|Es]) -> get_disk_data(Es);
  474: get_disk_data([E|Es]) -> [E|get_disk_data(Es)];
  475: get_disk_data([]) -> [].
  476: 
  477: %% @doc Test various expected inputs to 'df' command output (Linux/POSIX)
  478: parse_df_output_posix(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  479:     PosixHdr = "Filesystem     1K-blocks     Used Available Use% Mounted on\n",
  480:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df(PosixHdr, posix),
  481:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df("", posix),
  482:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df("\n\n", posix),
  483: 
  484:     %% Have a simple example with no funny spaces in mount path
  485:     Posix1 = "tmpfs             498048     7288    490760   2% /run\n",
  486:     {ok, {498048, 490760, 2, "/run"}, ""} = disksup:parse_df(Posix1, posix),
  487: 
  488:     %% Have a mount path with some spaces in it
  489:     Posix2 = "tmpfs             498048     7288    490760   2% /spaces 1 2\n",
  490:     {ok, {498048, 490760, 2, "/spaces 1 2"}, ""} = disksup:parse_df(Posix2, posix).
  491: 
  492: %% @doc Test various expected inputs to 'df' command output (Darwin/SUSv3)
  493: parse_df_output_susv3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  494:     DarwinHdr = "Filesystem 1024-blocks      Used Available Capacity " ++
  495:                 "iused      ifree %iused  Mounted on",
  496:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df(DarwinHdr, susv3),
  497:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df("", susv3),
  498:     {error, _} = disksup:parse_df("\n\n", susv3),
  499: 
  500:     %% Have a simple example with no funny spaces in mount path
  501:     Darwin1 = "/dev/disk1   243949060 157002380  86690680    65% 2029724 " ++
  502:               "4292937555    0%   /\n",
  503:     {ok, {243949060, 86690680, 65, "/"}, ""} = disksup:parse_df(Darwin1, susv3),
  504: 
  505:     %% Have a mount path with some spaces in it
  506:     Darwin2 = "/dev/disk1   243949060 157002380  86690680    65% 2029724 " ++
  507:               "4292937555    0%   /spaces 1 2\n",
  508:     {ok, {243949060, 86690680, 65, "/spaces 1 2"}, ""} = disksup:parse_df(Darwin2, susv3).
